qas.question: Who runs the school system in Myanmar ?
What country is Burma to credit for its academic system ?
Why is this country so influential to the Burma academics ?

answers.text: due to nearly a century of British and Christian presences in Myanmar.

qas.question: Are there any alternatives to the public school system in Burma ?
Are children required to go to school or can they choose to stay at home and work ?

answers.text: Schooling is compulsory until the end of elementary school

context: The educational system of Myanmar is operated by the government agency, <a0_0>the Ministry of Education<a0_0/>. The education system is based on the <a1_0>United Kingdom's<a1_0/> system <a2_0>due to nearly a century of British and Christian presences in Myanmar.<a2_0/> Nearly all schools are government-operated, but there has been a recent increase in <a3_0>privately funded English language schoo<a3_0/>ls. <a4_0>Schooling is compulsory until the end of elementary school<a4_0/>, approximately about 9 years old, while the compulsory schooling age is 15 or 16 at international level.
